text: Erwin Neher (;"Neher". Random House Webster's Unabridged Dictionary. ; born 20 March 1944) is a German biophysicist. His works focused on cell physiology. In 1991, with Bert Sakmann, he won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for "their discoveries concerning the function of single ion channels in cells". He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1989. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:German Nobel Prize winners Category:German physiologists Category:University of Wisconsinâ€“Madison alumni Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Erwin Neher
